projects.title: Microsoft Defender for Endpoint (MDE) to Azure Data Explorer (ADX) Integration
projects.description:
Objective:
Enable centralized security telemetry ingestion from Microsoft Defender for Endpoint into Azure Data Explorer to improve threat hunting, analytics, and cost optimization.

Key Contributions:

Designed and implemented a scalable pipeline to export MDE telemetry to Azure Storage + Azure Data Factory (ADF) for ingestion into Azure Data Explorer.

Replaced Event Hub–based ingestion (~€1750–1850/month) with Storage + ADF, reducing costs significantly while maintaining data freshness and query performance.

Developed ADF pipelines to handle data parsing, transformation, and ingestion into ADX with retry logic and error handling for reliability.

Benchmarked ingestion performance vs EventHub (latency, throughput, and cost), validating business case for migration.

Created Kusto Query Language (KQL) dashboards in ADX to support proactive threat hunting and incident investigations.

Defined governance & retention strategy in ADX (table partitioning, data lifecycle policies) for optimal storage and query performance.

Collaborated with SOC teams to build advanced detection use cases leveraging MITRE ATT&CK mapping in ADX queries.

Prepared Architecture Decision Record (ADR) documenting cost-benefit analysis, implementation steps, and migration roadmap.

Next Steps: Deprecating EventHub ingestion after stability validation of Storage+ADF pipeline.

Outcome:
✔ Reduced ingestion cost by >50%
✔ Improved SOC team's hunting efficiency with richer and faster ADX queries
✔ Eliminated dependency on high-cost EventHub premium setup
